name: Paradise Inn Windsor Palace Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two of us really enjoyed it.Old English elagance , bay views,tapestries hanging ,excellent staff,food,good location. Noise came from corniche mainly due to the egyptian drivers love of talking to each other by their horns [part of the atmosphere ]. This is not your 5 star chain hotel that could be anywhere its old world elegance, the lounge is memorable ,we would go again!
reviews.title: ice cold in alex.

reviews.text: Nice little hotel with excellent lobby and old elevator and the staff were very nice but..... the hotel was so noisy that we had to check in to another hotel. We tried 3 rooms but all of the doors and windows are old and have not been sealed so all the traffic noise from the corniche came straight in the room. It was like being on the road. The staff tried really hard to help but in the end their only solution was for us to put cotton wool in our ears - which we had to on the 1st night but it didn't make any difference. They really had very little understanding of the problem and seemed to feel that we weren't closing the windows properly. Definately do not stay here until they replace the windows and doors!
reviews.title: So Noisy we had to Leave

reviews.text: My friend and I based our ten day trip to egypt out of the Windsor Palace and couldn't be more pleased with our choice -
reviews.title: Staff was fabulous

reviews.text: The rooms were lovely and clean, complimentary breakfast was something to look forward to, and the staff bent over backwards to help us book trips.... It was like coming back to our friends each evening!
reviews.title: Mixed reactions to the Windsor Hotel
Lady Spencer Terrace
reviews.text: Location, across the street from the sea, was fantastic and within easy walking distance to shopping, food, and the bibliotheca alexandrina. We look forward to returning.

Recently returned from a visit to Alexandria. We went up by train 1st class. The train was filthy, it could really do with a clean and this is first class and it took 3 hours. Next time I would pay the extra and go by car. Stayed at Windsor Palace Hotel. Looks like Metropole on the outside. Has a wonderful old lift and the rooms are like a palace, high ceilings. The room was basic and clean. The toilet took a while to fill up when flusing. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in a hotel and we didnt hear a single noise from other occupants. The food was good and cheap and it is the first mini bar that I have come across where the items are cheaper than buying it outside. Just a word of mention, at reception there is a note which says that foreigners are not allowed to pay with Egyptian pounds, they must pay with foreign currency? Staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Windsor Palace hotel

description: Dating back to the early 20th century, this historic 4-star hotel is situated directly on Alexandria’s waterfront. Breakfast can be enjoyed on the rooftop terrace with panoramic Corniche views.The elegant rooms of Windsor Palace Hotel offer hand-decorated high ceilings. Each has a balcony, satellite TV and free Wi-Fi. Individually controlled air conditioning is standard in all rooms.Light snacks and refreshments can be enjoyed in the open-air Prince Charles Café with sea views. Decorated with antiques and frescos, the Queen Elizabeth Hall offers fine dining and wine.Guests will be ideally situated in the social and cultural hub of the city. There are several street cafés, shopping boutiques, and seaside promenades nearby. Alexandria Library is 1.5 km away.
